itt.t00154755.mouseapp

Class AccelerometerService

  • java.lang.Object
    • Service
      • itt.t00154755.mouseapp.AccelerometerService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientCommsInterface

    public class AccelerometerService
extends Service
implements ClientCommsInterface
    Since:
    10/02/2015
    Version:
    2.0

    This service runs in the background for the life of the application. It contains the Accelerometer sensor which returns an event each time the sensor changes (i.e. phone tilted to left, right, up or down). The event contains an integer array with the values of the x, y, and z axis. The service sends the data back to the main UI thread through a handler this data is then passed on to the client which in turn forwards it to the server. Refs:

    Android Developers Web-site

    http://developer.android.com/guide/components/services.html http://developer.android.com/guide/topics/sensors/sensors_overview.html

    Professional Android 2 Application Development

    Charter 14 - Blue-tooth, Networks, and WiFi http://www.wrox.com/WileyCDA/WroxTitle/Professional-Android-2-Application-Development.productCd-0470565527.html

    The New Boston Android Video Tutorials

    http://thenewboston.org/list.php?cat=6

    Author:
    Christopher Donovan, AccelerometerService.java, extends Service implements SensorEventListener, ClientCommsInterface

      • sendDataToUIThread

        public void sendDataToUIThread(java.lang.String data,
                               int type)
        ClientCommsInterface method to transfer data form this class back to the MainClientActivity class.

        • Type:
        • TOAST: A short message displayed on the user screen.
        • DATA: A reading taken from the Accelerometer.
        Specified by:
        sendDataToUIThread in interface ClientCommsInterface
        Parameters:
        data - String value to send back to main UI Thread.
        type - integer values to specify the type of data to be sent.
